Name: Abby
Notes: Rescued by Tiny Acres found neglected and starved.  Used as a brood mare for 20-ish years.

Name: Abe
Notes: Retired from City of Miami.  Has malignant cancer tumors under tail area - treat with Equiderma

Name: Acero
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Has a suspensory ligament issue in hind legs - saw him dragging hind legs on fetlock area one day.  Put shoe on right hind. Cruelty seize in Osceola County.

Name: Ahab
Notes: Ft. Carson Mounted Color Guard, retired due to ongoing lameness.

Name: Alf
Notes: Seized by Citrus Co Animal Services due to neglect - emaciated.

Name: Amadeus
Notes: Palm Beach Sheriff retiree - patrol, crowd control, parades & children's events

Name: Andy II
Farrier notes: Not done 1/14 - wouldn't go in paddock, Secure lead rope to fence post
Notes: Hard to catch.  Rescued by South FL SPCA, found abandoned and starved in the everglades.

Name: Angel
Notes: Best buddies with Fatima.  Came from Marion Co rescue - neglect case.  Ann had been working with her to regain trust in humans.

Name: Angel (new)
Notes: Rescued by Dreamcatcher Horse Rescue when owner surrendered due to old age.  Was western please horse

Name: Annie
Notes: Donated to Orange County Sherif and worked for 7 years.  Retired due to suspensory ligament issue in back leg.

Name: Apricot
Notes: Rescued from Marion Co, foundered.

Name: Archie
Notes: A rescue from Hope's Dream in Palatka

Name: Bandit
Farrier notes: OK for feet.  Don't feed anyone in field until done.
Notes: Did IM sedative first then IV after relaxed for dental 01/2026.  Did NOT get blood for Cushings in 09.2025 - afraid of needles.  Jacksonville Sheriff retiree, after developing lameness in 3 legs - arthritis

Name: Bear (Don't poke the bear)
Notes: OTTB rescued from Oklahoma slaughter auction

Name: Beau
Notes: Professional reining horse found neglected after owner entered hospice.  His best friend was Smarty.

Name: Blue
Farrier notes: Stiff on hind legs and can be a pain to catch
Notes: Rescued by Royal Blessing Rescue after owner of 15 years moved out of state and abandoned him.

Name: Bonnie
Notes: Found as a stray by Hendry Co Animal control.  Bonded to Clyed.

Name: Breaker
Notes: Started choking one Saturday.  Necropsy revealed impacted grass and viney weed in lower esophogus area.  Came to RHH with Cruise-both were psychiatric therapy horses.

Name: Bubbles
Notes: Rescued by SF SPCA when found at a foreclosed house in Miami.  Has melting suspensory ligaments.

Name: Buckaroo
Notes: Off track thoroughbred rescued from OK kill pen, with Ruby.

Name: Buddy
Notes: NO HOOF trims.  NO ORAL MEDS.  Shivers in hind legs, especially left.  Rescued by Marion County SPCA - starved.

Name: Buster
Notes: Shy

Name: Buttons
Notes: NO HOOF trims.  Rescued in Sumter Co FL - owner had terminal cancer.

Name: Cappy (El Capitan)
Notes: Retired from Ft. Lauderdale police.  Was a pleasure and show horse prior to PD.

Name: Captain Jack
Notes: Seized in cruelty case in Sumter Co, adopted out and returned when daughter "outgrew" him.

Name: Champaigne
Notes: One of 17 seized by Palm Beach Co. (with Sarge)

Name: Champion
Notes: Can be difficult to catch.  Usually put in paddock with Ivy and feed bucket. Rescued by SF-SPCA in 2005 cruelty case, adoped out and later returned

Name: Chance
Farrier notes: Sensitive on right hind - did last.  Overall he was good.
Notes: First horse I held at RHH for euthanasia.  Stopped eating and seemed more uncomfortable or in pain.  Didn't want carrot bites I gave him on 10/4/25 and didn't finish his food.  Seemed low or depressed.  Vet Eric examined him on 10/6 and determined cancer had developed further - like cluster of grapes.  Likely in pain.  After euthanized concentrated stuff came out of his bladder and there was urine in his abdomen/intersticial space.  [Nicole held for June hooves (not good?).  Left hind sore for April hooves - do others first.  Incontinent.  May have bladder or other cancer.]

Name: Charlie
Notes: Found at Alabama auction & purchased by community member to save from slaughter.

Name: Chipwich (Chip)
Notes: Was biting at stomach like it was itchy on 6/21 - last day I groomed him.  He got fly spray and a bit of a belly rub.  Can be a little sensitive when brushing in cinch area.  Rescued from a feedlot in NC by R.A.C.E.

Name: Christian
Notes: Rescued by RVR Horse Rescue neglected & starved, adopted out and returned.

Name: Cinderella
Notes: Has Cushings, sometimes gets abscesses in front hooves, sores in tail.  South FL SPCA rescue - found starved.

Name: Clyde
Notes: A little shy, good for hoof trims.  Found as a stray in Hendry Co.  Bonded to Bonnie (found together)

Name: Coco
Notes: Found starving with 3 others, rehab at Tiny Acres, arrived with Fancy.

Name: Comet
Notes: Abandoned at a boarding facility & owner was going to have him put down

Name: Commander
Farrier notes: Fronts only due to leakage on hind?
Notes: Retired from Ft. Lauderdale PD.

Name: Cruise
Notes: Arrived with Breaker.  Found abandoned by owners and had been psychiatric therapy horses.  Right eye removed due to ulcer.

Name: Dallas
Notes: Fine for Cushings blood draw.  Rescued by Hope's Dream in Palatka.

Name: Dan (Lt. Dan)
Farrier notes: Abcess on left front ruptured at coronory band 10/22
Notes: Degenerative joint disease.  Retired from Davie Police Dept.

Name: Desi
Notes: Surrendered by owner to Citrus Co.

Name: Diesel
Notes: Retired from Orange Co Sheriff due to bowed tendon.

Name: Diva
Farrier notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Didn't do 11/5 due to heaves, etc.
Notes: I got to be with her when she was euthanized.  Found her "swelled up" and struggling to breath when I caught her for meds.  Had bubbles/air under her skin when needle was inserted.  SEDATE for hoof trims.  Very shy.  Loves the red grooming brush and bananas.  Seized by Marion Co with 19 other animals, emaciated.

Name: Echo (Echoing Wind)
Notes: Blind in both eyes.  Polk Co Sheriff removed from owner when starved.

Name: Eclipse
Notes: Can be difficult to catch.  Surrendered to Sumter Co.

Name: Eli
Farrier notes: Really stiff on back but did ok
Notes: Retired from Ft. Lauderdale PD, was lead horse during protests and riots

Name: Emmett
Treatment Description: Teeth not checked - couldn't be sedated
Notes: Sometimes bolts when trying to halter - usually when just lead is on neck.  Served with Tater as caisson escort for over 500 veteran & first responders with Solemn Pride

Name: Enchanted Dancer
Farrier notes: Got in paddock with Shmoo prior to farrier truck moving up
Notes: Cushings.  Saved from slaughter feed lot in OK by R.A.C.E.

Name: Eyore
Notes: Has anhydrosis.  Sensitive on back (use strip hair to groom).  Worked at Jacksonville home for Children

Name: Faith
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  OTTB, jumper & dressage then Sarasota Co Sheriff - retired for medical issue.  Maybe doesn't like men?

Name: Fancy
Notes: Sometimes a little head shy since injury summer 2025.  Found malnourished and neglected, rehabed at Tiny Acres with Coco.

Name: Fatima
Notes: Difficult to catch - Nicole is most trusted person.  Rescued by Marion Co with 3 others.  Was bonded to Angel.

Name: Fiona
Notes: Was used for children riding lessons.  The breed originated from the mountains of western Norway

Name: Flicka
Notes: NO ORAL MEDS.  Use feed bucket with needles.  Found as a stray in Putnam Co, emaciated.  Age is likely an estimate

Name: Freckles
Notes: Moved to LYNNE'S PASTURE with Journey 11/10/25 (maybe stay?).  SFSPCA rescue

Name: Freedom
Farrier notes: SEDATE for hoof trims. Couldn't do 11/5 because of right front shoulder injury
Treatment Description: Couldn't do feet 11/25 due to injury
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  NO ORAL MEDS.  Insect bite sensitivity and a little shy.  Rescued by RVR Horse Rescue from abuse and starvation.

Name: Friday
Notes: Rescued from TN slaughter auction by community with 49 others

Name: General (Brigadier General)
Notes: Retired from Sarasota County Sheriff.  Was jumper/dressage prior to being donated to sheriff.

Name: George
Notes: Found abandoned and starved in Miami /Dade area.  Very sore and stiff for April 2025 hooves - increase Prevacox?

Name: GI (Grand Illustrator)
Farrier notes: FRONT ONLY - left hind too wobbly
Notes: Left hind sore for May hooves - do others first.  Did pulled back but might need to pull forward.  Retired Hernando County Sheriff.

Name: Ginny
Notes: Good aggressive!  Former Appaloosa show horse in western and reining.

Name: Glory
Notes: No blood taken for Cushings 09.2025.  SEDATE for hoof trims.  Founds emaciated, 6 months rehab before arriving to RHH.

Name: Grace
Notes: Rescued by Tiny Acres after purchase from AL slaughter auction.

Name: Guido
Notes: Retired from Davie Police Dept.  Full name is "Guidoinaspeedo"

Name: Hazel
Farrier notes: Gets anxious if field next door is fed!
Notes: Great for blood draw 09.2025.  Generally NO NEEDLES, but did ok w/ right hand only on neck for blood.  Seized by Lake Co found abandoned.

Name: Helen
Notes: Rescued by SF SPCA when found abandoned.  Blind and partially deaf, she loved carrots and attention.  Journey was protective of her.

Name: Homer
Notes: Rescued by SF SPCA found abandoned in nursery full of trash, no water, blind in one eye and lame in one front leg - feared humans.

Name: Honey
Notes: Seized by Lake Co Animal Services, found abandoned - owner was squatting on property after becoming homeless

Name: Hoodee
Notes: Euthanized due to quality of life tied to laminitis/hooves.  Rescued by Dream Catcher when found in poor condition and suffering from lameness

Name: Hope
Notes: Former racehorse rescued by Lake Co animal control found starved and neglected.  Dream Catcher found RHH home for her.

Name: Indy
Notes: SFSPCA rescue, found abandoned

Name: Inky
Notes: Surrendered to Okeechobee Sheriff by boarding facility when owner would no longer pay for boarding.  Scarring from harsh use of bit.

Name: Ivy
Farrier notes: Better with bucket?  Maybe sensitive on right hind
Notes: Marion county rescue, found abandoned.

Name: Jasmine
Notes: Likely died of colic?  Suffered a "stroke" of some sort in 2024 and thought she would die but she lived for a year+ after.

Name: Journey
Notes: Hillsborough Co rescued, starved and eating dog food, plastic, etc.

Name: June
Notes: Abandoned in South FL with 3-yr old filly, both not able to stand and had to be hoisted up.  SFSPCA rehabbed

Name: Kahlua
Farrier notes: SEDATE?? All feet done with sedation 01/2026.  Did FRONT hoof trims only in Dec (Brandon-no sedation) - was on NO TRIM list prior
Notes: Good for 1/26 trim.  Kept Beau by her.  Tried to pull front right away, but otherwise like an "angel" for trims.  Was on NO HOOF trim list.  Was sedated and still kicked for hoof trims.  Right eye removal June 2025.  In trailer accident and surrendered by owner.

Name: Katie
Notes: Rescued from Hillsborough county.  Developed serious colic and had to be euthanized.

Name: Lady Rizzi
Notes: Rescued from kill pen auction in OK by RACE Fund, OTTB with $373K+ winnings then was a broodmare.

Name: Layla
Notes: Can be particular during grooming and better if haltered.  Rescued by Marion Co - emaciated.

Name: Legacy
Notes: Retired from Sarasota Sheriff, was a show horse before that (possibly the Olympics!?)

Name: Leo
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Has shivers in hind legs.  Let him bend at fetlock and rest before picking up hind legs.  Was Sarasota County Sheriff, Dressage/jumping prior.

Name: Liberty
Notes: Retired Palm Beach Co Sheriff, and cart horse prior in TN.  Arthritis caused retirement

Name: Little Faith
Notes: No eyes.  Found abandoned and starved in Brooksville, rescued by a neighbor and turned over to Wild Horse Rescue Center.

Name: Loretta
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Saved from livestock auction.

Name: Louie
Notes: Rescued by Marion Co - emaciated.

Name: Lovey
Notes: Born in New Zealand.  Rescued by South FL SPCA, sign for "free horse"

Name: Luca
Notes: NO ORAL MEDS.   Rescued by Horses That Help from "meat sale"

Name: Lucky
Notes: NO HOOF trims.  Use feed bucket with needles, pellet dewormer.  Rescued with 4 others found starving.

Name: Luna
Notes: Tends to kick.  Groomers should do mane and tail first.  Rescued by Tiny Acres, starved.

Name: Lynn
Notes: NO HOOF trims.  Seized by Palm Beach Co, starved with 17 others.

Name: Ma Impekhable
Notes: Rescued when found abandoned on an Ocala farm

Name: Macarena
Notes: Rescued by SFSPCA, adopted out and later returned.  Has string halt in left rear leg.

Name: Maggie
Notes: Fell down during trim ~06.2025.  Stability issues on hind legs - hoof trims may not be possible much longer (04/2025) Estimated age.  Rescued from Everglades

Name: Major
Notes: Retired from Orange Co Sheriff after 10 years and raced prior to that.

Name: Maple
Notes: Rescued by SF SPCA, found abandoned in east everglades with back feet tied to a tree.

Name: Mashantie
Notes: Former PMU horse and essentially wild

Name: Maxine
Notes: Shy and particular.  Will chase off the mules.  Rescued by Hope Equine, emaciated in backyard in Polk Co.

Name: Midnight
Notes: Retired from JAX sheriff.  Has PSSM1 muscle disorder, which leads to abnormal glycogen storage in muscles.  Needs low starch, low sugar diet.

Name: Miley
Notes: More wary of men.  Rescued from N. Carolina.  A molly mule (female horse, male donkey)

Name: Mio
Farrier notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Couldn't catch 01/28
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Can be difficult to catch - use feed bucket, grooming bag, treat?  Ann is favorite person.  Rescued with Satchi by SFSPCA in neglect case.

Name: MIss Cortina
Notes: Has strange knot/bump on left side of neck.  Rescued from slaughter auction in TX by Race Fund, with Satin Blue

Name: Mo
Farrier notes: Secure lead rope to fence post
Treatment Description: Just held leadrope. Sensitive on right hind
Notes: Sometimes needs to be haltered, but liking grooming more.  Tether lead rope around fence post when doing hoof trims.  Arrived with Tabitha.  Rescued in 2007 by Tampa Bay SPCA & lived at their farm for 10 years.

Name: Molly
Farrier notes: SEDATE?? for hoof trims. Done WITHOUT sedation on 1/28/26
Treatment Description: Put in paddock for hoof trims, etc.
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Does NOT like needles and may bolt!!  Was an Amish mule sold at auction.  Rio is best friend.

Name: Ms. Miami
Notes: Retired from Miami PD.  Had strangulating lipoma in small intestine and had surgery to save her.

Name: Muddy Money
Farrier notes: LF has to go forward due to old injury
Notes: Rescued by Marion Co - emaciated.

Name: Nelson
Notes: Rescued by Dreamcatcher Horse Rescue when left by owner after their house sold, with Willie.  Passed away over night.

Name: Nitro
Notes: Rescued after surrender by owner to Polk Co Sheriff.  Former show horse.

Name: Omega
Notes: Navicular disease in front hooves.  Retired from Davie Police Dept.

Name: Oreo
Notes: Halter for grooming - tends to wander.  Increasing lack of eye sight.  Tobiano coloring.  Retired from Equine Assisted Therapies.

Name: Orion (2 hind, left front white)
Notes: Tut is sire.  Rescued.

Name: Oscar
Notes: The very first horse I groomed at RHH.  He retired from Orange Co Sheriff and had Cushings disease.

Name: Pancho
Notes: Rescued by Tiny Acres when found starved, neglected and medical issues.

Name: Patrick
Notes: Died of sudden colic.  Just had teeth floated the prior week and was great at grooming on 1/19.  Originally found loose on a highway searching for food, then neglected at a boarding facility.  Tiny Acres rescued.

Name: Pepper
Farrier notes: Used to require twitch, Brandon has done 3 times w/o
Notes: Rescued in hoarding case, emaciated and abused.

Name: Pete
Notes: Timid.  Fine for Cushings blood draw.  A rescue from Palatka, with Dallas.

Name: Peyton
Notes: Afraid of NEEDLES, go slow - did ok w/right hand only on neck. Bad cut on right haunches 06/2025.  Rescued by Faith Equine Rescue, knee injury

Name: Phoenix
Notes: Shy and can be difficult to catch.  Use slower approach, feed bucket, banana helps.  Ruby is best friend.  Rescued by Skip Over Troubleâ€¦found discarded and neglected.

Name: Portia
Notes: Rescued by RVR Horse Rescue neglected & starved, adopted out and returned.  Christian is her best friend.

Name: Possum
Farrier notes: Able to do normal - may have to pull fronts forward
Notes: Served in US Army, Ft. Carson CO Color Guard - retired due to arthritis

Name: Red
Notes: Is a little more shy since Mom and Sister (Chaz and Baby) died.  Rescued by Tiny Acres from barn emaciated and neglected.  Had been used in "The Big Lick" show organization for exaggerated gaits

Name: Rhoda
Notes: Rescued by Miami SPCA.  Very gentle and great to groom.

Name: Rio
Notes: Worked at Disney as a trail riding horse.  Adoped out and surrendered to Wild Horse Rescue.  Best friend is Molly the mule.

Name: Roman
Farrier notes: Fronts only - may have to pull forward
Notes: Retired from Orange Co Sheriff and was a racehorse prior.

Name: Romeo
Notes: Rescued when found starved and neglected, then returned by prior adopter

Name: Ruby
Farrier notes: Kicked farrier 10/2025, rinse legs before next farrier
Notes: Off track thoroughbred rescued from OK kill pen

Name: Rusty
Notes: Front right shoulder may have "sweeney shoulder" condition, or suprascapular neuropathy.  First pulled a wagon, then saddle work, then Broward Co Sheriff

Name: Sage
Notes: One of 5 starving horses rescued

Name: Sarge
Farrier notes: Good but sore on left hind (stinky fetlock)
Notes: One of 17 seized by Palm Beach Co.

Name: Satchi
Farrier notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Couldn't catch 01/28
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Can be difficult to catch - use feed bucket, grooming bag, treat?  Rescued with Mio by SFSPCA in neglect case.

Name: Satin Blue
Notes: Rescued from slaughter auction in TX by Race Fund, with Miss Cortina

Name: Scout
Notes: Retired from Orange Co Sheriff, Key West Police prior to that.  Trigeminal-mediated head shaking and arthritis in front knees.

Name: Shai
Notes: SEDATE for hoof trims.  Seized in neglect case, adopted out for 2 years and returned to the rescue.

Name: Shalimar
Farrier notes: Pull front legs forward for trims (bad knees)
Notes: Pull front legs forward for trims (bad knees).  Rescued by Faith Equine Rescue - found starving w/5 others.

Name: Shamrock
Notes: Rescued from roadside zoo in south FL.

Name: Sheba
Notes: Tends to bite when scared or frustrated!  Rescued by Marion Co - emaciated.

Name: Shmoo
Notes: Retired from Key West PD

Name: Sir Phillip
Farrier notes: Hard to catch but ok with hooves
Notes: Difficult to catch, NOT sedated for hoof trims.  Found as a stray and still a stallion until 4 months before arriving at RHH.

Name: Sir Valahad
Farrier notes: Do right front first - old injury
Notes: Right front bowed tendon, do other feet first for trims.  (Had fractured front leg.)  Seems to chew on tongue when nervous

Name: Skippy
Notes: Rescued in Citra, FL and again when adopted family did not care for her

Name: Slider
Notes: Found abandoned and rescued by SFSPCA.  Extremely weak and unable to stand, used a pad to slide him out of the stall, thus his name.

Name: Smarty
Notes: Was a professional reining horse.  He and Beau found locked in stalls for 5 months after owner entered hospice.

Name: Spirit
Notes: Afraid of NEEDLES, go slow and did good 09.2025.  Prior time did ok w/ right hand only on neck for blood.  Rescued from a kill pen auction by Dreamcatcher.

Name: Stormy
Notes: May have Cushings?.  Seized by Baker Co, cruelty case.

Name: Sunny
Notes: Surrendered with hip injury and barbed wire cuts, to Rainbow's Edge rescue

Name: Tabitha
Notes: Arrived with Mo from Tampa SPCA

Name: Tackemup
Farrier notes: Pull front legs forward for trims (bad knees)
Notes: Pull front legs forward for trims (bad knees).  Bred at Farmsworth Farms in Ocala.  Did some racing.  Saved from AL cattle auction

Name: Taka
Farrier notes: Not done in Dec due to injury
Notes: Rescued by SFSPCA found starved, adopted out and then returned

Name: Tank
Farrier notes: Catch first, then Ginny unless Ann gets them
Notes: Retired from Palm Beach Co Sheriff, arthritis in hocks.  Mother was a PMU horse and he was set for slaughter as a foal, rescued by PBCSO

Name: Tater
Farrier notes: Sensitive on right hind.  Early signs of shivers?
Notes: Served with Tater as caisson escort for over 500 veteran & first responders with Solemn Pride

Name: Tiger
Treatment Description: Teeth not checked - couldn't be caught, kicked dentist
Notes: NO HOOF trims.  Rescued by Osceola Co in large neglect case.

Name: Tonka (new)
Notes: Teeth floated 06/2025.  Front shoes removed 5/2025

Name: Traveler
Notes: Ft. Carson Mounted Color Guard, had glaucoma and old leg injury.

Name: Trixie
Notes: Rescued by Dreamcatcher when found abandoned.

Name: Trooper
Notes: Has permanent hock damage due to roping/tie-down "training" and head shy from recent ear injury treatment.  Cannot handle his hind legs (??)

Name: Tut
Notes: Orion is offspring.  Rescued together

Name: Viva Slew
Notes: ADS got to lead to the welcome paddock.  OTT Rescue from slaughter.  Granddaughter of triple crown winner Seattle Slew.

Name: Welaka
Notes: NO HOOF trims.  DIFFICULT W/ ORAL MEDS.  Seems food aggressive and will nip/bite.  Rescued by Putnam Co Sheriff - tied to a gate.

Name: Willie
Notes: Abandoned with Nelson at a home when prior owner sold the property.

Name: Winston
Notes: Retired from Tampa Police with lameness in front feet.  Papers identify his coloring as a blue roan.

Name: Yoshi
Farrier notes: Able to do hinds in October
Notes: Was in ESSEX field and moved after Diva died.  Suffers contracted hind tendons due to eating day-blooming jasmine.  Rescued by SFSPCA in 1999, adopted and found at a mustang rescue in 2015.

Name: Zach
Notes: Retired Davie PD and Ft. Lauderdale prior to that, and racing prior.  Stifle swelling caused retirement.
